clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Iohexol ia used in myelography arthrography nephroangiography arteriography and other radiographic procedures

contraindications.disease: Non ionic radiocontrast agents like iohexol are cytotoxic to renal cells The toxic effects include apoptosis cellular energy failure disruption of calcium homeostasis and disturbance of tubular cell polarity and are thought to be linked to oxidative stress
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Iohexol is an effective non ionic water soluble contrast agent which is used in myelography arthrography nephroangiography arteriography and other radiographic procedures Its low systemic toxicity is the combined result of low chemotoxicity and low osmolality

incompatibilities.description: The risk of a hypersensitivity reaction to Iohexol is increased when it is combined with Aldesleukin
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Iohexol is combined with Metformin
The therapeutic efficacy of Lorazepam can be decreased when used in combination with Iohexol
The therapeutic efficacy of Pregabalin can be decreased when used in combination with Iohexol
